- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Code refactoring
- [ ] Test coverage improvement
- [ ] Infrastructure/DevOps change

<!-- Verify code quality standards -->

## Checklist

<!-- Final checklist before requesting review -->

### Before Requesting Review

- [ ] Code is self-documenting or well-commented
- [ ] All tests pass locally
- [ ] Linter passes without errors
- [ ] Code formatted according to project standards
- [ ] Branch is up to date with main/develop
- [ ] No merge conflicts
- [ ] Commit messages are clear and descriptive

### Testing Requirements

- [ ] Unit tests added for new functions
- [ ] Integration tests added for service interactions
- [ ] E2E tests added for critical user flows (if applicable)
- [ ] Test coverage meets minimum threshold
- [ ] No flaky tests introduced
- [ ] Test documentation updated

### Documentation

- [ ] README updated (if needed)
- [ ] API documentation updated (if needed)
- [ ] Inline code comments added
- [ ] CHANGELOG updated (if needed)
- [ ] Migration guide provided (if breaking change)

### Review Readiness

- [ ] PR title is clear and descriptive
- [ ] PR description is complete
- [ ] Labels added appropriately
- [ ] Reviewers assigned
- [ ] Project/milestone assigned (if applicable)

## Additional Notes

<!-- Any additional information for reviewers -->



## Reviewer Guidelines

### For Reviewers

Please verify:

1. **Code Quality**
   - Code is readable and maintainable
   - Follows project conventions
   - No obvious bugs or issues
   - Error handling is appropriate

2. **Testing**
   - Tests are meaningful and comprehensive
   - Coverage is adequate
   - Tests follow project standards
   - No flaky tests

3. **Security**
   - No security vulnerabilities introduced
   - Input validation is proper
   - Authentication/authorization is correct

4. **Performance**
   - No obvious performance issues
   - Database queries are optimized
   - API responses are efficient

5. **Documentation**
   - Code is well-documented
   - Complex logic is explained
   - API changes are documented

### Review Checklist

- [ ] Code changes reviewed
- [ ] Tests reviewed and verified
- [ ] Documentation reviewed
- [ ] Security considerations checked
- [ ] Performance impact assessed
- [ ] Breaking changes identified
- [ ] Deployment plan reviewed
